name: io::error::repr_bitpacked::Repr::new_simple

core::num::NonZero::<T>::new_unchecked.doc:
Creates a non-zero without checking whether the value is non-zero.
 This results in undefined behavior if the value is zero.

 # Safety

 The value must not be zero.

core::ptr::NonNull::<T>::without_provena.doc:
Creates a pointer with the given address and no [provenance][crate::ptr#provenance].

 For more details, see the equivalent method on a raw pointer, [`ptr::without_provenance_mut`].

 This is a [Strict Provenance][crate::ptr#strict-provenance] API.

core::cmp::PartialEq::eq.doc: Tests for `self` and `other` values to be equal, and is used by `==`.

core::panicking::panic_fmt.doc:
The entry point for panicking with a formatted message.

 This is designed to reduce the amount of code required at the call
 site as much as possible (so that `panic!()` has as low an impact
 on (e.g.) the inlining of other functions as possible), by moving
 the actual formatting into this shared place.
